name: HD 143361
scenarioDescription:
The HD 143361 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 143361 is a star with 0.97 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.92 times its radius. It is located 223.91 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 2.942 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 143361 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 143361 system


HD 143361 b

HD 143361 b was discovered by the Las Campanas Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.99 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 143361 b is 1123.176 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 143361 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 143361, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Las Campanas Observatory.
